what: The ilostat R package in a few words
title: Rilostat
text: R package provides tools access, download work data contained ILOSTAT, ILO Department Statistics’ online database. ILOSTAT’s data related metadata also directly available ILOSTAT’s website. information ILOSTAT’s R package, including contact details source code, refer github page.

title: Rilostat
text: ILO’s main online database, ILOSTAT, maintained Department Statistics, world’s largest repository labour market statistics. covers countries regions wide range labour-related topics, including employment, unemployment, wages, working time labour productivity, name . includes time series going back far 1938; annual, quarterly monthly labour statistics; country-level, regional global estimates; even projections main labour market indicators. ILOSTAT’s website provides immediate access data related metadata different ways. Basic users can simply view desired data online download Excel csv formats. advanced users can take advantage ILOSTAT’s well-structured bulk download facility (user guide), SDMX web service (user guide). ilostat R package ('Rilostat') designed give data users ability access ILOSTAT database, search data, rearrange information needed, download desired format, make various data visualizations, programmatic replicable manner, possibility quickly re-running queries required.

what: Main features of the ilostat R package
title: Rilostat
text: Provides access annual, quarterly, monthly data available via ILOSTAT bulk download facility (user guide) Allows search download data related metadata English, French Spanish Gives ability return POSIXct dates easy integration plotting time-series analysis techniques Returns data long format direct integration packages like ggplot2 dplyr Gives immediate access recent updates Allows grep-style searching data descriptions names Provides access ILOSTAT catalogue related descriptive metadata (user guide)

title: Rilostat
text: developer package drew extensive inspiration eurostat R package related documentation: Retrieval Analysis Eurostat Open Data eurostat Package - Leo Lahti, Przemyslaw Biecek, Markus Kainu Janne Huovari. R Journal 9(1), 385-392, 2017.

title: Rilostat
text: install release version, use following command: install development version, use following command: ilostat R package ('Rilostat') includes following functions: expect update ilostat R package often, based questions remarks ILOSTAT data users, progressively create examples, tutorials, demos apps. Please visite Rilostat package website.
code: install.packages("Rilostat") if(!require(devtools)){install.packages('devtools')} install_github("ilostat/Rilostat") require(Rilostat) as.data.frame(ls("package:Rilostat")) ##   ls("package:Rilostat") ## 1    clean_ilostat_cache ## 2   distribution_ilostat ## 3            get_ilostat ## 4        get_ilostat_dic ## 5        get_ilostat_toc ## 6          label_ilostat ## 7           sdmx_ilostat

title: Rilostat
text: Unless already know code indicator ref_area (reference area - countries regions) want download, first step search data interested . get_ilostat_toc() provides grep style searching available indicators ILOSTAT’s bulk download facility returns indicators matching query. get_ilostat_toc(segment = 'ref_area') returns datasets available ref_area (‘country’ ‘region’). access table contents available indicators ILOSTAT (indicator):  Table 1a. Extract, ‘Table contents indicator English’  settings available 3 official languages ILO: English ('en'), French ('fr') Spanish ('es'). default 'en'. instance, access table contents available datasets reference area ILOSTAT Spanish:   Table 1b. Extract, ‘Table contents ref_area Spanish’ can search words expressions within table contents listing ILOSTAT’s indicators. example, searching word “bargaining” return indicators containing word somewhere indicator information:  Table 1c. ‘Table contents indicator search word ’bargaining’’ Similarly, can also search list available datasets reference area given reference area (using country region name code) even given data frequency (annual, quarterly monthly). search also allows look several alternative /additional items . instance, look datasets annual data either Albania France:  Table 1d. ‘Table contents ref_area search words ’France’ ‘Albania’ ‘Annual’’ can also manipulate ILOSTAT’s table contents’ dataframe using basic R filter. already familiar ILOSTAT data way structured, can easily filter want. example, know beforehand want data ILOSTAT’s Short Term Indicators dataset (code “STI”) interested monthly data (code “M”) can simply :  Table 1e. Extract, ‘Table contents indicator filtered Monthly Short term indicators’
code: toc <- get_ilostat_toc() toc <- get_ilostat_toc(segment = 'ref_area', lang = 'es') toc <- get_ilostat_toc(search = 'bargaining') toc <- get_ilostat_toc(segment = 'ref_area', search = c('France|Albania', 'Annual'),                                              fixed = FALSE) toc <-  dplyr::filter(get_ilostat_toc(), collection == 'STI', freq == 'M')

title: Rilostat
text: function get_ilostat() explores ILOSTAT’s datasets returns datasets indicator (default, segment indicator) reference area (segment ref_area). id dataset made code segment chosen (indicator code reference area code) code data frequency required (annual, quarterly monthly), joined underscore.

title: Rilostat
text: stated , can easily access single dataset choice get_ilostat() function, indicating code dataset desired (indicator_frequency ref_area_frequency). want access annual data indicator code UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB, type:  Table 2a. Extract, ‘Annual unemployment sex age, ILO modelled estimates, Nov. 2018’ want access annual data available ILOSTAT Armenia:  Table 2b. Extract, ‘Armenia, annual data’
code: dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A', segment = 'indicator') dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'ARM_A', segment = 'ref_area')

title: Rilostat
text: also possible download multiple datasets , simply setting dataset’s id vector ids tibble lists ids specific column:
code: dat <- get_ilostat(id = c('AFG_A', 'TTO_A'), segment = 'ref_area')   dplyr::count(dat, ref_area) ## # A tibble: 2 × 2 ##   ref_area      n ##   <chr>     <int> ## 1 AFG      347669 ## 2 TTO      362734 toc <- get_ilostat_toc(search = 'CPI_')  dat <- get_ilostat(id = toc, segment = 'indicator', quiet = TRUE)   dplyr::count(dat, indicator) ## # A tibble: 6 × 2 ##   indicator            n ##   <chr>            <int> ## 1 CPI_ACPI_COI_RT 145305 ## 2 CPI_MCPI_COI_RT 138954 ## 3 CPI_NCPD_COI_RT 576620 ## 4 CPI_NCYR_COI_RT 655479 ## 5 CPI_NWGT_COI_RT  34842 ## 6 CPI_XCPI_COI_RT 686635

title: Rilostat
text: function get_ilostat() return time period information default raw time format (time_format = 'raw'), character vector following syntax: Yearly data: 'YYYY' YYYY year. Quarterly data: 'YYYYqQ' YYYY year Q quarter (number corresponding quarter 1 4). Monthly data: 'YYYYmMM' YYYY year MM month (number corresponding month 01 12). ease use data plotting time-series analysis techniques, function can also return POSIXct dates (using time_format = 'date') numeric dates (using time_format = 'num'). instance, following return quarterly unemployment data sex age, time dimension numeric format:  Table 3a. Extract, ‘Quarterly unemployment sex age’ following return monthly time-related underemployment data sex age, time dimension POSIXct date format:  Table 3b. Extract, Monthly time-related underemployment sex age
code: dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'UNE_TUNE_SEX_AGE_NB_Q', time_format = 'num') dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'TRU_TTRU_SEX_AGE_NB_M', time_format = 'date')

title: Rilostat
text: function get_ilostat() stores cached data default file.path(tempdir(), "ilostat") rds binary format. However, via cache_dir arguments, also possible choose different work directory store data , via cache_format arguments can save formats, csv, dta, sav, sas7bdat. arguments can also set using options(ilostat_cache_dir = 'C:/temp') options(ilostat_cache_format = 'dta'). name cache file built using paste0(segment, "-", id, "-", type,"-",time_format, "-", last_toc_update ,paste0(".", cache_format)), ‘last_toc_update’ latest update dataset table contents. argument back = FALSE, datasets downloaded cached without returned R. quiet setting convenient particularly downloading large amounts data datasets.
code: dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'TRU_TTRU_SEX_AGE_NB_M', cache_dir = 'c:/temp', cache_format = 'dta') get_ilostat(id = get_ilostat_toc(search = 'SDG'),   cache_dir = 'c:/temp', cache_format = 'dta',                                                      back = FALSE)

title: Rilostat
text: retrieved /cached dataset(s) need, advanced filters can help refine data selection facilitate reproducible analysis. can apply several different filters datasets, filter data reference area, sex, classification item, etc.  argument detail set default filter aggregation. instance, detail = 'serieskeysonly' return distinct combinations ref_area/source/indicator/sex/classif1/classif2, whereas detail = 'dataonly' remove columns obs_status/note_classif/note_indicator/note_source dataset detail = 'serieskeysonly' select best source (based lowest source sort id) ref_area/./indicator/sex/classif1/classif2/time levels.   Table 4a. Extract, Youth male unemployment rate Brazil South Africa (ILO modelled estimates, Nov. 2018), ‘Series Key’   Table 4b. Extract, Youth female unemployment rate Brazil South Africa (ILO modelled estimates, Nov. 2018) order delete files cache just run:
code: options(ilostat_cache_dir = 'C:/temp') dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'UNE_2EAP_SEX_AGE_RT_A', filters = list(                                                     ref_area = c('BRA', 'ZAF'),                                                      sex = 'T',                                                      classif1 = 'AGE_YTHADULT_Y15-24')) dplyr::count(dat, ref_area, sex, classif1) ## # A tibble: 2 × 4 ##   ref_area sex   classif1                n ##   <chr>    <chr> <chr>               <int> ## 1 BRA      SEX_T AGE_YTHADULT_Y15-24    35 ## 2 ZAF      SEX_T AGE_YTHADULT_Y15-24    35 options(ilostat_cache_dir = 'C:/temp') dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'UNE_2EAP_SEX_AGE_RT_A', filters = list(                                                     ref_area = c('BRA', 'ZAF'),                                                      sex = 'M',                                                      classif1 = 'AGE_YTHADULT_Y15'),                                                  detail = 'serieskeysonly') # options(ilostat_cache_dir = 'C:/temp') dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'UNE_2EAP_SEX_AGE_RT_A', filters = list(                                                     ref_area = c('BRA', 'ZAF'),                                                      sex = 'F',                                                      classif1 = 'AGE_YTHADULT_Y15'),                                                  detail = 'dataonly') clean_ilostat_cache()

title: Rilostat
text: Now found datasets needed filtered desired data, can start manipulating ILOSTAT data reproducible manner, even use favourite R packages make great data visualizations. example, can use ggplot2 dplyr visually compare trends male labour force participation rate Germany, France United States, since 2005 (see ). lineal graph allows us see male labour force participation rate considerably higher United States Germany France, decreasing steady pace since around 2008, closing gap participation rates particularly Germany, male labour force participation rate slightly increased last period observed.   can also build interesting (visually telling) stacked columns bars. example, based ILOSTAT data, can plot distribution employed persons economic class (defined according household’s per capita income/consumption per day). can even several disaggregations: example , chose show employment distribution economic class separately men women youth adults. figure, clearly understand working poverty (poor spite employed) affects youth much adults, women men.   can also combine ilostat package packages create triangular graphs, plotting three different indicators relate topic whose observations mutually exclusive. can use type graph, instance, visually convey share employed population working agriculture, industry services, three compared, even revealing, compare across countries. example , used three different indicators labour underutilization (unemployment, time-related underemployment discouraged job-seekers) study inter-related selected countries. three population groups mutually exclusive, part broad category labour underutilization. Unemployment represents persons employment, available employment actively seeking employment, discouraged job-seekers persons employment available employment actively look employment specific reasons situation labour market, time-related underemployment refers persons employment like work hours available work hours current working time. graph brings light differences across countries labour underutilization composition, showing unemployment biggest concern, opposed time-related underemployment discouragement.   also possible create maps showing indicators behave across world given point time (static maps) even time (dynamic maps allowing user scroll available time period). instance, built map see differences across world youth unemployment rate. , selected data compilation methodologically robust consistent across countries ensure international comparability: ILO modelled estimates (November 2017). can change legend settings use color coding best suits data. case, colour scale used allows us quickly see youth unemployment rates particularly high Southern Northern Africa.
code: require(Rilostat) require(ggplot2, quiet = TRUE) require(dplyr, quiet = TRUE)    get_ilostat(id = 'EAP_DWAP_SEX_AGE_RT_A',                time_format = 'num',                filters = list( ref_area = c('FRA', 'USA', 'DEU'),                                sex = 'SEX_M',                               classif1 = 'AGE_AGGREGATE_TOTAL',                               timefrom = 2005, timeto = 2019))  %>%    select(ref_area, time, obs_value) %>%    ggplot(aes(x = time, y = obs_value, colour = ref_area)) +    geom_line() +    ggtitle('Male labour force participation rate in selected countries, 2005-2019') +    scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(2005, 2017, 3)) +   labs(x="Year", y="Male LFPR (%)", colour="Country:") +     theme(legend.position = "top", plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) require(Rilostat) if(!require(ggplot2)){install.packages('ggplot2')} if(!require(dplyr)){install.packages('dplyr')}      get_ilostat(id = 'EMP_2EMP_SEX_AGE_CLA_DT_A',                  filters = list( ref_area = 'ZAF',                                  time = '1999',                                  sex = c('M', 'F'),                                  classif1 = c('Y15-24', 'YGE25'))) %>%      filter(!classif2 %in% 'CLA_ECOCLA_TOTAL') %>%      mutate( sex =       factor(sex) %>% recode_factor(                                 'SEX_M' = 'Male',                                  'SEX_F' = 'Female'),              classif1 =  factor(classif1) %>% recode_factor(                                 'AGE_YTHADULT_YGE25' = 'Adult',                                  'AGE_YTHADULT_Y15-24' = 'Youth'),             classif2 =  factor(classif2) %>% recode_factor(                                 'CLA_ECOCLA_USDLT2' = '<US$1.9',                                  'CLA_ECOCLA_USDGE2LT3' = '>=US$1.9 & <US$3.2',                                  'CLA_ECOCLA_USDGE3LT5' = '>=US$3.2 & <US$5.5',                                  'CLA_ECOCLA_USDGE5' = '>=US$5.5')) %>%      ggplot(aes(y=obs_value, x=as.factor(classif1), fill=classif2)) +     geom_bar(stat="identity") +     facet_wrap(~as.factor(sex)) + coord_flip() +     theme(legend.position="top") +     ggtitle("Employment by economic class, sex and age, South Africa, 1999") +     labs(x="Age group", y="Distribution of economic class (%)", fill="Economic class : ") +      theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5)) +      scale_fill_brewer(type = "div") require(Rilostat) if(!require(tidyr)){install.packages('tidyr')} if(!require(dplyr)){install.packages('dplyr')} if(!require(plotrix)){install.packages('plotrix')} if(!require(stringr)){install.packages('stringr')}  triangle <- get_ilostat(id = c('EIP_WDIS_SEX_AGE_NB_A',                                 'UNE_TUNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A',                                 'TRU_TTRU_SEX_AGE_NB_A'),                          filters = list(                                       ref_area = c('ZAF', 'MNG', 'CHL'),                                        source = 'BA',                                       sex = 'SEX_T',                                        classif1 = 'YGE15',                                        time = '2013'),                               detail = 'dataonly',                                cmd = "dat %>% select(ref_area, indicator, obs_value)",                                quiet = TRUE) %>%             label_ilostat() %>%             group_by(ref_area.label) %>%             mutate(obs_value = obs_value / sum(obs_value)) %>% ungroup() %>%             mutate(indicator.label = indicator.label %>%                                        str_replace(fixed(' by sex and age (thousands)'), '')) %>%             spread(indicator.label, obs_value)  par(cex=0.75, mar=c(0,0,0,0)) positions <- plotrix::triax.plot(                       as.matrix(triangle[, c(2,3,4)]),                       show.grid = TRUE,                       main = 'Selected labour underutilization indicators',                       label.points= FALSE, point.labels = triangle$ref_area.label,                       col.axis="gray50", col.grid="gray90",                       pch = 19, cex.axis=1.2, cex.ticks=0.7, col="grey50")                                             ind <- which(triangle$ref_area.label %in%  triangle$ref_area.label)  df <- data.frame(positions$xypos, geo =  triangle$ref_area.label)  points(df$x[ind], df$y[ind], cex=2, col="red", pch=19)  text(df$x[ind], df$y[ind], df$geo[ind], adj = c(0.5,-1), cex=1.5) require(Rilostat) if(!require(plotly)){install.packages('plotly')} if(!require(dplyr)){install.packages('dplyr')} if(!require(stringr)){install.packages('stringr')}  dat <- get_ilostat(id = 'UNE_2EAP_SEX_AGE_RT_A', filters = list(                                 time = '2019',                                  sex = 'SEX_T',                                  classif1 = 'AGE_YTHADULT_Y15-24'                                 )) %>%              filter(!str_sub(ref_area,1,1) %in% 'X') %>%              select(ref_area, obs_value) %>%              left_join(  Rilostat:::ilostat_ref_area_mapping %>%                              select(ref_area, ref_area_plotly)%>%                              label_ilostat(code = 'ref_area'),                          by = "ref_area") %>%              filter(!obs_value %in% NA)                    dat %>%      plot_geo(              z = ~obs_value,              text = ~ref_area.label,              locations = ~ref_area_plotly         ) %>%          add_trace(             colors = 'Blues',             marker = list(                         line = list(                             color = toRGB("grey"),                              width = 0.5)                     ),              showscale = TRUE         ) %>%         colorbar(             title = '%',              len = 0.5         ) %>%         layout(           title = 'Youth unemployment rate in 2019 (ILO modelled estimates, Nov. 2020)',            geo = list(                        showframe = FALSE,                       showcoastlines = TRUE,                     projection = list(type = 'natural earth'),                      showcountries = TRUE,                      resolution = 110) # or 50             )

title: Rilostat
text: information ilostat R package, please contact: ILO Department Statistics (ilostat@ilo.org) specific issues concerning code source, please report github questions related ilostat database contact (ilostat@ilo.org) visit ilostat website Permission reproduce ILO publication data: reproduction ILO material generally authorized non-commercial purposes within established limits. However, may need submit formal request certain circumstances. information please refer : https://www.ilo.org/global/copyright https://www.ilo.org/global/copyright/request--permission

title: ILO Open Data via Ilostat Bulk Download Facility or SDMX Web Service
text: ILO’s main online database, ILOSTAT, maintained Department Statistics, world’s largest repository labour market statistics. covers countries regions wide range labour-related topics, including employment, unemployment, wages, working time labour productivity, name . includes time series going back far 1938; annual, quarterly monthly labour statistics; country-level, regional global estimates; even projections main labour market indicators. ILOSTAT’s website provides immediate access data related metadata different ways. Basic users can simply view desired data online download Excel csv formats. advanced users can take advantage ILOSTAT’s well-structured bulk download facility (user guide), SDMX web service (user guide). ilostat R package ('Rilostat') designed give data users ability access ILOSTAT database, search data, rearrange information needed, download desired format, make various data visualizations, programmatic replicable manner, possibility quickly re-running queries required.

title: Clean Ilostat Cache — clean_ilostat_cache
text: Deletes cache files ilostat cache directory.              See get_ilostat cache.

title: Clean Ilostat Cache — clean_ilostat_cache
code: clean_ilostat_cache(   cache_dir = getOption("ilostat_cache_dir", file.path(tempdir(), "ilostat")),   cache_update = getOption("ilostat_cache_update", FALSE),   quiet = getOption("ilostat_quiet", FALSE) )

title: Clean Ilostat Cache — clean_ilostat_cache
text: cache_dir character, path cache directory. directory exist. NULL (default) uses creates 'ilostat' directory temporary directory tempdir. directory can also set option ilostat_cache_dir, cache_update logical whether delete date cache files. Useful cache_dir  set keep update datasets. Can set also   options(ilostat_update = TRUE). Default FALSE. quiet logical, TRUE , return message processing, FALSE (default). Can set also options(ilostat_quiet = TRUE),

text: See citation("Rilostat") ilostat bulk download facility user guidelines  https://webapps.ilo.org/ilostat-files/Documents/ILOSTAT_BulkDownload_Guidelines.pdf

text: David Bescond bescond@ilo.org

title: Switch ilostat to distribution — distribution_ilostat
text: Get distribution ilostat number persons .

title: Switch ilostat to distribution — distribution_ilostat
code: distribution_ilostat(x, var)

title: Switch ilostat to distribution — distribution_ilostat
text: x dataset transform distribution. var String variable name use distribution default "",  "sex", "classif1", "classif2".

title: Switch ilostat to distribution — distribution_ilostat
text: data_frame. obs_status longer number persons percentage.

title: Switch ilostat to distribution — distribution_ilostat
text: function use max corresponding grouping  		important filter subset corresponding variable selected distribution 	level, ie. remove SEX_T, distribution sex SEX_F SEX_M / max(SEX_M, SEX_F) * 100, 	longer distribution. addition, distribution applicable indicators Number persons (usually thousands),  	plse distribute ratios, earnings, hours works, CPI, GDP etc ... warning prevent 	doubts use distribution get_ilostat() instead , warnings help .

title: Switch ilostat to distribution — distribution_ilostat
code: if (FALSE) {  dat <- get_ilostat("EMP_TEMP_SEX_STE_GEO_NB_A", cache = FALSE)  dat_dist <- distribution_ilostat(dat, "classif1")  head(dat_dist)  clean_ilostat_cache()  }

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
text: Download datasets ilostat https://ilostat.ilo.org via bulk download facility  https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/bulk/.

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
code: get_ilostat(   id,   segment = getOption("ilostat_segment", "indicator"),   type = getOption("ilostat_type", "code"),   lang = getOption("ilostat_lang", "en"),   time_format = getOption("ilostat_time_format", "raw"),   filters = getOption("ilostat_filter", "none"),   fixed = getOption("ilostat_fixed", TRUE),   detail = getOption("ilostat_detail", "full"),   cache = getOption("ilostat_cache", TRUE),   cache_update = getOption("ilostat_cache_update", TRUE),   cache_dir = getOption("ilostat_cache_dir", NULL),   cache_format = getOption("ilostat_cache_format", "rds"),   back = getOption("ilostat_back", TRUE),   cmd = getOption("ilostat_cmd", "none"),   quiet = getOption("ilostat_quiet", FALSE) )

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
text: id code name dataset interest. See get_ilostat_toc details get code. segment character, way get datasets : "indicator" (default) "ref_area". Can set also options(ilostat_segment = 'ref_area'), type character, type variables, "code" (default), "label" "". Can set also options(ilostat_type = ''), lang character, code language. Available "en" (default),  "fr" "es". Can set also options(ilostat_lang = 'fr'), time_format string giving type conversion time column ilostat format. "raw" (default) conversion return time character (ie. '2017', '2017Q1', '2017M01'). "date" converted Date first date period. "date_last" converted Date last date period "num" converted numeric. Can set also  options(ilostat_time_format = 'date'), filters list; "none" (default) get whole dataset named list filters get just part table. Names list objects ilostat variable codes values vectors observation codes. filters detect variables, partial, ie. list(sex = 'T') enough equivalent list(sex = 'SEX_T'). Additional options: timefrom : starting year return dataset, timeto : ending year return dataset. fixed logical, TRUE (default), filters arguments pattern string matched , Change FALSE complex regex matching needed. detail character, 'full' (default), whether 'serieskeysonly', return    key, data, notes dataonly return key data, notes 'bestsourceonly' return  best source series key levels, see details.    Can set also options(ilostat_detail = 'serieskeysonly'), cache logical whether caching. Default TRUE. Affects     queries ilostat bulk download facility.  Can set also options(ilostat_cache = FALSE), cache_update logical whether update cache. Check cache update last.update attribute store cache file name   one table contents. Can set also options(ilostat_cache_update = FALSE). Default TRUE, cache_dir path cache directory. directory exist. NULL (default) uses creates 'ilostat' directory temporary directory tempdir. directory can also set option ilostat_cache_dir, cache_format character, format store cache "rds" (default), also "csv", "dta",  "sav", "sas7bdat". useful getting ilostat dataset directly cache_dir without R.        Can set also options(ilostat_cache_format = 'dta'), back logical, TRUE return dataframe R FALSE, useful just saving file specific cache_format, cmd character, R expression use manipulate internal data frame dat object applied datasets retrieved  use, cache set FALSE. see examples. quiet logical, TRUE , return message processing, FALSE (default). Can set also options(ilostat_quiet = TRUE),

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
text: tibble. One column dimension data         values column numerical values, well metadata columns.         time column time dimension.

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
text: Data sets downloaded   ilostat bulk download facility.    table id given, whole table downloaded   bulk download facility. bulk download facility fastest method download whole datasets.   also often way sdmx API limitation maximum    300 000 records time whole datasets usually exceeds . default datasets bulk download facility cached   often rather large. Cache files stored temporary directory default   named directory cache_dir option ilostat_cache_dir defined.   cache can emptied clean_ilostat_cache. id, code, dataset can searched   get_ilostat_toc [bulk download facility](https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/bulk/).

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
text: See citation("Rilostat") ilostat bulk download facility user guidelines https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/bulk/

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
text: David Bescond bescond@ilo.org

title: Read Ilostat Data — get_ilostat
code: if (FALSE) { ############# get simple dataset  dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A")  head(dat)  dat <- get_ilostat("NZL_Q", segment = "ref_area")  head(dat)   dir.create(file.path(tempdir(), "r_cache"))  dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A",                    cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "r_cache"))  head(dat)   clean_ilostat_cache(cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "r_cache"))    options(ilostat_update = TRUE)  dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A")  head(dat)  options(ilostat_update = FALSE)  options(ilostat_cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "r_cache"))  dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A")   clean_ilostat_cache()   ############# get multiple datasets  dat <- get_ilostat(c("CPI_ACPI_COI_RT_M", 'CPI_ACPI_COI_RT_Q'), cache = FALSE)  head(dat)  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(search = 'CPI_')  head(toc)  dat <- get_ilostat(toc, cache = FALSE) #id as a tibble  ############# get datasets with filters  dat <- get_ilostat(id = c("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A", 'EMP_2EMP_SEX_AGE_NB_A'),       filters = list(  ref_area = "FRA",       classif1 = "AGE_YTHADULT_YGE15",       time = "2016",      sex = c("T", 'SEX_F')), quiet = TRUE)  head(dat)  clean_ilostat_cache()   ############# store in other format  dir.create(file.path(tempdir(), "ilostat"))   dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A",                    cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "r_cache"), cache_format = 'csv')  dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A",                    cache_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "r_cache"), cache_format = 'dta')  ############# advanced manipulation   dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A", cmd = "dat %>% count(ref_area)", quiet = TRUE)  label_ilostat(dat, code = 'ref_area')   clean_ilostat_cache() }

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
text: Downloads one ilostat dictionary ilostat https://ilostat.ilo.org via bulk download facility  https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/bulk/.

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
code: get_ilostat_dic(dic, lang = getOption("ilostat_lang", "en"))

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
text: dic character, dictionary variable downloaded, lang character, code language. Available "en" (default),  "fr" "es". Can set also options(ilostat_lang = 'fr'),

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
text: tibble two columns: code names full names.

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
text: given coded variable ilostat https://ilostat.ilo.org/.    dictionaries link codes human-readable labels.    translate codes labels, use label_ilostat.

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
text: See citation("Rilostat") ilostat bulk download facility user guidelines  https://webapps.ilo.org/ilostat-files/WEB_bulk_download/ILOSTAT_BulkDownload_Guidelines.pdf ilostat bulk download facility main page  https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/bulk/

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
text: David Bescond bescond@ilo.org

title: Read Ilostat Dictionary — get_ilostat_dic
code: if (FALSE) {  tmp <- get_ilostat_dic("indicator")  head(tmp)  tmp <- get_ilostat_dic("classif1", lang = "fr")  head(tmp) }

what: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
text: Download one table contents ilostat https://ilostat.ilo.org via bulk download facility  https://ilostat.ilo.org/data/bulk/.

title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
code: get_ilostat_toc(   segment = getOption("ilostat_segment", "indicator"),   lang = getOption("ilostat_lang", "en"),   search = getOption("ilostat_search", "none"),   filters = getOption("ilostat_filter", "none"),   fixed = getOption("ilostat_fixed", TRUE) )

title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
text: segment character, way get datasets : "indicator" (default) "ref_area",  Can set also options(ilostat_segment = 'ref_area'), lang character, code language. Available "en" (default),  "fr" "es". Can set also options(ilostat_lang = 'fr'), search character vector, "none" (default), datasets pattern description returned,    characters vector use , Character '|' , see example, options(ilostat_time_format = 'date'), filters list; "none" (default) get whole toc named list filters get just part table. Names list objects ilostat toc variable codes values vectors observation codes. filters detect variables. fixed logical, TRUE (default), pattern string matched , Change FALSE complex regex matching needed.

title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
text: tibble ten columns depending segment: indicator ref_area  id : codename dataset theme, used get_ilostat get_ilostat_raw functions, indicator ref_area : indicator ref_area code dataset, indicator.label ref_area.label : indicator ref_area name dataset, freq  : frequency code dataset, freq.label : freq name dataset, size : Size csv.gz files, data.start : First time period dataset, data.end : Last time period dataset, last.update : Last update dataset, ... : Others relevant information

title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
text: TOC English indicator downloaded https://webapps.ilo.org/ilostat-files/WEB_bulk_download/indicator/table_of_contents_en.csv.  values column 'id' used download selected dataset. TOC English ref_area downloaded https://webapps.ilo.org/ilostat-files/WEB_bulk_download/ref_area/table_of_contents_en.csv.  values column 'id' used download selected dataset.

title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
text: See citation("Rilostat") ilostat bulk download facility user guidelines https://webapps.ilo.org/ilostat-files/WEB_bulk_download/ILOSTAT_BulkDownload_Guidelines.pdf

title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
text: David Bescond bescond@ilo.org

title: Read Ilostat Table of Contents — get_ilostat_toc
code: if (FALSE) { ## default segment by indicator, default lang English  toc <- get_ilostat_toc()  head(toc)  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(segment = 'ref_area', lang = 'fr')  head(toc) ## ## search on toc  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(search = 'education')  head(toc)  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(lang = 'fr', search = 'éducation')  head(toc)  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(segment = 'ref_area', lang = 'fr', search = 'Albanie')  toc  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(segment = 'ref_area', lang = 'es', search = 'Trimestral')  head(toc) ## ## search multi on toc  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(segment = 'ref_area', lang = 'fr',               search = 'Albanie|France', fixed = FALSE)  head(toc)  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(search = 'youth|adult', fixed = FALSE)  head(toc)  toc <- get_ilostat_toc(search = c('youth','adult'), fixed = FALSE)  head(toc) ## }

what: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
text: Gets definitions/labels ilostat codes ilostat dictionaries.

title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
code: label_ilostat(   x,   dic = NULL,   code = NULL,   lang = getOption("ilostat_lang", "en") )

title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
text: x character factor vector data_frame labelled. dic string (vector) naming ilostat dictionary dictionaries. NULL (default) dictionary names taken column names  data_frame. character factor vector data_frame labelled, code vector names column code columns retained. Set "", keep code. lang character, code language. Available "en" (default),  "fr" "es". Can set also options(ilostat_lang = 'fr'),

title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
text: vector data_frame. suffix ".label" added code column names.

title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
text: character factor vector codes returns corresponding vector definitions.    label_ilostat labels also data_frames get_ilostat. vectors dictionary    "time" "values" columns returned , can supply data_frame get_ilostat    get data_frame definitions instead codes.

title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
text: See citation("Rilostat") ilostat bulk download facility user guidelines  https://webapps.ilo.org/ilostat-files/Documents/ILOSTAT_BulkDownload_Guidelines.pdf

title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
text: David Bescond bescond@ilo.org

title: Switch Ilostat codes and labels — label_ilostat
code: if (FALSE) {  dat <- get_ilostat("UNE_2UNE_SEX_AGE_NB_A", cache = FALSE)  dat_lab <- label_ilostat(dat)  head(dat_lab)  clean_ilostat_cache()  }

what: Read Ilostat Data, Metadata via ILO SDMX api — sdmx_ilostat
title: Read Ilostat Data, Metadata via ILO SDMX api — sdmx_ilostat
text: query codelist, data metadata via ilo sdmx api

title: Read Ilostat Data, Metadata via ILO SDMX api — sdmx_ilostat
code: sdmx_ilostat(   dsd,   sdmx_resource = getOption("ilostat_sdmx_resource", "codelist"),   sdmx_format = "csv",   lang = getOption("ilostat_lang", "en"),   count = getOption("ilostat_sdmx_count", FALSE),   quiet = getOption("ilostat_quiet", FALSE) )

title: Read Ilostat Data, Metadata via ILO SDMX api — sdmx_ilostat
text: dsd datastructure definition, see examples section, sdmx_resource : character, type info returned sdmx api: 'codelist' (default),  'data', 'dataflow', 'conceptref', sdmx_format : data , character, format info returned sdmx api: 'csv' (default) others longer available. lang character language. Available "en" (default),  "fr" "es". Can set also options(ilostat_lang = 'fr'), count logical, count data records resource = 'data', FALSE (default), quiet logical, TRUE , return message processing, FALSE (default). Can set also options(ilostat_quiet = TRUE).

title: Read Ilostat Data, Metadata via ILO SDMX api — sdmx_ilostat
text: See citation("Rilostat") ilostat sdmx user guidelines: https://webapps.ilo.org/ilostat-files/Documents/SDMX_User_Guide.pdf

title: Read Ilostat Data, Metadata via ILO SDMX api — sdmx_ilostat
text: David Bescond bescond@ilo.org

title: Read Ilostat Data, Metadata via ILO SDMX api — sdmx_ilostat
code: if (FALSE) { ########## get codelist # fetch indicator define on ILOSTAT  dic <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = "CL_INDICATOR", lang ="en")  head(dic)  # fetch country available on ILOSTAT  dic <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = "CL_AREA", lang ="es")  head(dic)  # fetch classif ECO version available on ILOSTAT  dic <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = "CL_ECO", lang ="en")  head(dic)  # fetch note type available on ILOSTAT  dic <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = "CL_NOTE_TYPE", lang ="en")  head(dic)  # fetch note "Repository" available on ILOSTAT  dic <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = "CL_NOTE_R1", lang ="en")  head(dic)  ######## get data  # to get the order of the filter first get the conceptref of the DSD   filter_position <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = 'EMP_TEMP_SEX_AGE_NB',              sdmx_resource = 'conceptref')  filter_position  # COUNTRY and FREQ are in first and second position of the filters   dat <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = "EMP_TEMP_SEX_AGE_NB/FRA+DEU.Q...",                      sdmx_resource = 'data')  head(dat)  ### with attribute  dat <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = 'EMP_TEMP_SEX_AGE_NB/ARG.Q...',                      sdmx_resource = 'data')  head(dat)  # without attribute  dat <- sdmx_ilostat(dsd = "EMP_TEMP_SEX_AGE_NB/ARG.Q...?detail=dataonly",                      sdmx_resource = 'data')  head(dat)   ########## count data available   sdmx_ilostat("UNE_TUNE_SEX_AGE_NB/FRA.Q...",                       sdmx_resource = 'data', count = TRUE)  }
